content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my preference for security and avoidance of risk, I would choose a strategy that ensures a consistent payoff over the long run, even if it's slightly lower. In this game, choosing B guarantees a payout of 20$ per round. Since the game has 75 rounds, by choosing B consistently, I can earn 1500$.

However, there is a chance that my opponent might choose R to exploit the difference in our payouts when we make different choices (45$ versus 20$). To minimize this risk, I could occasionally switch my strategy to R to keep my opponent guessing and potentially reduce their chances of consistently exploiting me. This way, I can still earn a decent amount even if they do choose R at some point.

Ultimately, my choice would be B {B}, but with occasional switches to R throughout the game to keep things unpredictable.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

In light of my previous decision to occasionally switch strategies, I would switch to choosing B in this round {B}. This move ensures that I earn a guaranteed 20$ and minimize the potential impact of my initial choice on my overall earnings in the game. It also helps me gather more information about my opponent's strategy, as they may have exploited my previous choice for their advantage. By switching strategies, I maintain a balance between security and potential exploitation while maximizing my chances of earning a reasonable payoff over the long run.
